title: Test topic - part 2

So I opened this one to test until (hopefully) the old test topic will be recovered).-----------------

title: Re: Test topic - part 2
content:
The ezBoard servers are under constant maintainance at the moment, so they'll crash at regular intervals. Don't be surprised if the topics that are here now disappear too. Not that it matters as such...

title: Re: Test topic - part 2
content:
Not when you see what I've got coming in the next week or so. Here's a clue: I needed to look at the spacing around the "new topic" symbol, and nobody was posting at the time.

EDIT: Never mind waiting, here you go: [url=http://toxicsheep.com/forums/]link[/url]

In case you hadn't guessed, it's a test forum (not an actual forum) with a phpBB theme I'm in the process of building on it. I'm a long way from finishing the theme, but I thought I'd post the link here anyway.

title: ezboard emulated?
content:
I'm not quite sure I think it's a good idea to try and emulate ezboard.
A large part of it is personal preference I suppose, but I don't think the way ezboard menus etc. work, is the best.

Hmmm, maybe it's just that when I see something new, I want it to actually look different. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: ezboard emulated?
content:
Fair enough - I'm not a great designer, and I can't really conceive a good design. I decided to copy the existing design because I couldn't think of a better one and I thought it would be nice to have a nostalgic feel on the new boards for those who wanted one. If I can concieve a better design that I think I can actually create, I'll create it.
My [url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?grafix5000]MindBending Power[/url] is 5.43 points.
Possibly the [url=http://legion.gibbering.net/misterx/troutwar.php?s=grafix5000]funniest thing[/url] on the interweb.
Go to [url=http://www.toxicsheep.com]www.toxicsheep.com[/url] to see my site!

[img]http://www.toxicsheep.com/sigs/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: Re: ezboard emulated?
content:
It's just 1 opinion, don't value it more than it deserves to be valued. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
I understand the sentimental value, nostalgia is a nice thing.
Is it possible to create multiple designs and let the forum's visitors change them on the fly?
That way you're already done with 1 design, and can just add a new one, or even new ones later.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten.

title: Re: ezboard emulated?
content:
It is indeed. Some forums, though, push this a bit too far. (I believe the [url=http://zzt.the-underdogs.org/fora/]z2 Forums[/url] have over 40 different styles, most of which are very poor.)

I did have another idea for a theme, but it would require a large helmet graphic drawn from a certain angle and in a non-pixelated style - I couldn't draw it myself and am not aware of any such graphic existing.
My [url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?grafix5000]MindBending Power[/url] is 5.43 points.

title: Re: ezboard emulated?
content: Given that these are Commander Keen forums, perhaps a strong Commander Keen in-game style would be appropriate?  One thing I'd like with a new forum would be ever so slightly smaller Keen smilies - the ones we've got now are just large enough that they put big gaps between lines of text...

title: Re: ezboard emulated?
content:
More original Keen graphics would be neat.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
And it was joke graphix. Nice looking test forum.You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!
